title: Estimate standard deviation of interest histogram

content.description: A marketing firm obtained random samples of 20 people in five regions of the country to investigate the level of interest in a new product. People in the sample were asked to rate their level of interest on a scale from 1 to 10, with 1 being the least amount of interest and 10 being the greatest. The histograms show the results for each region.
content.question: The graph for which region displays data for level of interest with the least standard deviation?

choices.label: The figure presents a histogram titled “Region A.” The horizontal axis is labeled “Level of Interest,” and the numbers 0 through 10, in increments of 1, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Frequency,” and the numbers 0 through 8, in increments of 1, are indicated. The data represented by the bars are as follows.  Level of interest, 1. Frequency, 2. Level of interest, 2. Frequency, 2. Level of interest, 3. Frequency, 0. Level of interest, 4. Frequency, 0. Level of interest, 5. Frequency, 0. Level of interest, 6. Frequency, 0. topic.text: 1.7: Summary Statistics for a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Compare distributions or relative positions of points within a distribution.
